comments:
stable 20020125

[I am sure that I am wearing the hat of cluelessness so preapologies]

See the attached snapshot.
When I pop up the menu in the console view and choose open type nothing 
happens. Not even a beep.  I've tried selecting some text, selecting different 
things in the thread/stack area all with no effect. So I'm assuming its broken.

Created an attachment (id=305)
Snapshot of debugger - notice no editors are yet open

Works for me in latest code base. Select some text in the console such 
as "ArrayIndexOutOfBounds" and then "Open on type", an editor will open 
on "java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBounds".

In a stack trace, placing the cursor on any line (selection or none), the 
action will open to the method described by that line of the stack trace.
Created attachement with example of successful "open on".

I believe I see the catch. My console had wads of tracing output but didn't 
have any class/method names yet even when I had nothing selected the operation 
was still enabled so I assumed it didn't pertain to having to have a 
method/class in the output but perhaps was somehow tied to the thread the 
console was associated with.

So basically I got sucked into thinking it was something else. 

I think as simple as it sounds that graying the menu operation when nothing is 
selected (or the selection is whitespace) would help clarify that it relates to 
selection.
Agreed. We should improve the enablement of the action.

I was able to produce an error dialog saying "Error parsing console document"

* ran  a program that created a stack dump (modified VectorTest, to print stack 
trace in #testElementAt, for array index out of bounds)
* used the open on selection feature to open types (at variours places in stack 
trace)
* removed all termianted launches
* action was still enabled in pop-up menu, even though lauch was gone and 
console was now clear (noticed the console title did not change to blank).
* invoking the action produced the "Error parsing" dialog.

Also found this trace in the .log

With all terminated removed I could never get the action to be enabled.
Cannot reproduce error in 20020212. Marking as fixed.
